title: Otsuka Pharmaceutical Finalizes Agreement with Naruto City and Toyota Tsusho Corporation to Promote Horizontal ... - otsuka.co.jp
summary: Otsuka Pharmaceutical collaborates with Naruto City and Toyota Tsusho Corporation to promote horizontal recycling of PET bottles for sustainable resource circulation.
green_innovation: TRUE, The collaborative agreement aims to contribute to a sustainable society by promoting the horizontal 'bottle-to-bottle' recycling of PET bottles, which aligns with environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, The agreement involves new processes for recycling PET bottles and creating PET bottles for re-use, thereby introducing new business processes for sustainable resource circulation.
green_product: TRUE, The initiative focuses on designing, manufacturing, and using PET bottles in a way that significantly reduces environmental impact throughout their lifecycle, aligning with the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE, The collaboration emphasizes green processes in manufacturing and production by promoting the recycling of PET bottles to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325412 Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing, 325998 All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 562920 Materials Recovery Facilities, 562112 Hazardous Waste Collection
greenwashing: FALSE, The article describes a genuine collaboration focused on sustainable recycling practices without any indication of false or misleading environmental claims.

title: ACI responds to NY law limiting solvent in personal care products - CosmeticsDesign.com USA
summary: The article discusses the regulations and challenges related to 1,4-dioxane levels in consumer products, particularly in personal care and cosmetic products. It also explores methods to assess and mitigate contamination, potential health concerns, and reformulation strategies for reducing exposure.

title: Venterra Farms Launches Sustainably Grown Cannabis Powered by Farming First - PR Newswire
summary: Venterra Farms, a cannabis brand by Farming First, uses a hybrid farming approach combining indoor tech with outdoor sustainability. They focus on high-quality cannabis while being environmentally mindful and supporting community causes.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation as it combines technology with sustainability to produce cannabis in an environmentally conscious manner.
business_innovation: TRUE. This qualifies as a business innovation due to the introduction of a new cannabis brand with a unique hybrid farming approach, different from traditional methods.
green_product: TRUE. Venterra Farms' sustainably grown cannabis fits the definition of a green product with its focus on reducing environmental impact throughout the product lifecycle.
green_process: TRUE. Venterra Farms' hybrid farming approach that incorporates sustainable practices aligns with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 111998 - All Other Miscellaneous Crop Farming, 115112 - Soil Preparation, Planting, and Cultivating, 325411 - Medicinal and Botanical Manufacturing, 424910 - Farm Supplies Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it promotes genuine sustainability practices such as hybrid farming and community donations.

title: Blinkit to Expand Dark Store by 40 pc over Next 1 yr - Indian Retailer
summary: Blinkit plans to expand its micro-fulfillment centers or dark stores by up to 40% in the next 12 months to enhance quick commerce services. The company reported revenue growth without expanding dark store footprint, and expects advertisement revenue to become a significant revenue driver.
